comment: A third of Hispanic immigrants are following the th century assimilation model and becoming Republicans. A third are sinking into America's hip hop underclass. The other third are so transient and disengaged from the country they're visiting that they're politically inert.
amr:
# ::snt A third of Hispanic immigrants are following the th century assimilation model and becoming Republicans. A third are sinking into America's hip hop underclass. The other third are so transient and disengaged from the country they're visiting that they're politically inert.
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (a / and
            :op1 (f / follow-02
                  :ARG0 (p / person
                        :ARG1-of (ii / include-91
                              :ARG2 (p2 / person
                                    :ARG0-of (ii2 / immigrate-01)
                                    :mod (e / ethnic-group
                                          :name (n / name
                                                :op1 "Hispanic")))
                              :ARG3 "3/4"))
                  :ARG1 (m2 / model
                        :mod (a2 / assimilate-01
                              :time (d / date-entity
                                    :century 20))))
            :op2 (b / become-01
                  :ARG1 p
                  :ARG2 (p3 / person
                        :ARG0-of (h / have-org-role-91
                              :ARG1 (p4 / political-party
                                    :name (n2 / name
                                          :op1 "Republican"))))))
      :snt2 (s / sink-01
            :ARG1 (p5 / person
                  :ARG1-of (ii3 / include-91
                        :ARG2 (p6 / person
                              :ARG0-of (ii4 / immigrate-01))
                        :ARG3 "3/4"))
            :ARG4 (u / underclass
                  :mod (h2 / hip-hop)
                  :mod (c / country
                        :name (n3 / name
                              :op1 "America"))))
      :snt3 (h3 / have-degree-91
            :ARG1 (p7 / person
                  :ARG1-of (ii5 / include-91
                        :ARG2 p6
                        :ARG3 "3/4"))
            :ARG2 (a3 / and
                  :op1 (t / transient)
                  :op2 (d2 / disengage-01
                        :ARG1 p7
                        :ARG2 (c2 / country
                              :ARG1-of (v / visit-01
                                    :ARG0 p7))))
            :ARG3 (s2 / so)
            :ARG6 (ii6 / inert
                  :mod (p8 / politics)
                  :domain p7)))

comment: I would also rather they not assimilate. I'm just observing that rather than adding a "third race" to america's black/white dichotomy, they're drifting into whitening or blackening. Some Latin American immigrants are actually, factually White, but they're the exception, and I would also rather even the "bright 'n light" ones stay home.
amr:
# ::snt I would also rather they not assimilate. I'm just observing that rather than adding a "third race" to america's black/white dichotomy, they're drifting into whitening or blackening. Some Latin American immigrants are actually, factually White, but they're the exception, and I would also rather even the "bright 'n light" ones stay home.
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (p / prefer-01
            :ARG0 (ii / i)
            :ARG1 (a / assimilate-01
                  :polarity -
                  :ARG0 (t / they))
            :mod (a2 / also))
      :snt2 (o / observe-01
            :ARG0 (ii2 / i)
            :ARG1 (d / drift-01
                  :ARG1 (t2 / they)
                  :ARG2 (o2 / or
                        :op1 (w / white-02
                              :ARG1 t2)
                        :op2 (b / blacken-01
                              :ARG1 t2))
                  :ARG1-of (ii3 / instead-of-91
                        :ARG2 (a3 / add-02
                              :ARG0 t2
                              :ARG1 (r / race
                                    :ord (o3 / ordinal-entity
                                          :value 3))
                              :ARG2 (d2 / dichotomy
                                    :mod (b2 / black-05)
                                    :poss (c / country
                                          :name (n / name
                                                :op1 "America"))))))
            :mod (j / just))
      :snt3 (c2 / contrast-01
            :ARG1 (w2 / white-02
                  :ARG1 (p2 / person
                        :ARG0-of (ii4 / immigrate-01)
                        :mod (s / some)
                        :mod (e / ethnic-group
                              :name (n2 / name
                                    :op1 "Latin"
                                    :op2 "America")))
                  :ARG1-of (a4 / actual-02))
            :ARG2 (e2 / except-01
                  :ARG1 p2))
      :snt4 (p3 / prefer-01
            :ARG0 (ii5 / i)
            :ARG1 (s2 / stay-01
                  :ARG1 (p4 / person
                        :ARG1-of (l / light-06)
                        :ARG1-of (d3 / dark-03)
                        :mod (e3 / even))
                  :ARG3 (h / home))
            :mod (a5 / also)))

comment: Just because someone comes from a different country doesn't mean they are worth less than you.
amr:

(m / mean-01
      :polarity -
      :ARG1 (c / come-01
            :ARG1 (s / someone)
            :ARG3 (c2 / country
                  :ARG1-of (d / differ-02)))
      :ARG2 (w / worth-01
            :ARG1 s
            :ARG2 (l / less)
            :ARG4 (y / you))
      :mod (j / just))
